channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: WHO calls for booster pause to vaccinate poorer nations
item.description: WHO chief says it would allow at least 10% of the population in every country to be vaccinated.

item.title: Dalit girl rape and murder: Indians protest over girl's forced cremation
item.description: A couple accuse a priest and three others of raping and murdering their daughter, aged nine.

item.title: Belarus protests: Trial of opposition figures begins
item.description: Protest organiser Maria Kolesnikova has been charged with threatening national security.

item.title: Beirut blast: ‘The day our city exploded’
item.description: One year on from the blast that rocked Beirut, no one has yet been made accountable.

item.title: Floods: Research shows millions more at risk of flooding
item.description: Numbers of people exposed to flooding globally have risen by almost a quarter in two decades.

item.title: Rihanna now officially a billionaire
item.description: The star is now the wealthiest female musician in the world, according to Forbes.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sky Brown becomes GB's youngest medallist, plus sailing and showjumping golds
item.description: Great Britain are fourth in the Olympic medal table after sailing and showjumping golds plus a skateboarding bronze for Sky Brown, 13.

item.title: Barack Obama scales back 60th birthday party as Covid cases rise
item.description: The former president turns 60 on Wednesday but has cancelled plans for a big party this weekend.

item.title: USS Bonhomme Richard fire: Suspect identified as 20-year-old Navy sailor
item.description: A newly unsealed warrant also reveals suspicions that fire stations on the ship were sabotaged.

item.title: Greece wildfires force people to flee island by boat
item.description: Scores of people on Evia were forced to evacuate by sea as wildfire spread rapidly, destroying homes.

item.title: Selena Gomez criticises latest 'tasteless' TV transplant joke
item.description: The Good Fight is the latest show to reference singer Selena Gomez's 2017 kidney transplant.

item.title: Belarus sprinter Krystina Timanovskaya arrives in Poland
item.description: Krystina Timanovskaya was granted a humanitarian visa after she refused orders to fly home early.

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Why is the NY Governor under pressure to resign?
item.description: Democrats, including President Biden, have called for the New York governor to go.

item.title: Tunisia crisis: Democrats, despots and the fight for power
item.description: Tunisia is in turmoil since the president suspended parliament and increased his own power.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Belarus dissidents who disappeared and died
item.description: For years opponents of Belarus leader Alexander Lukashenko have been hounded - sometimes fatally.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: Lebanon blast: ‘Path towards reform irreversible’
item.description: We owe it to our people to tackle issues which led to the blast, the ambassador to the UK says.

item.title: ‘I can’t study sitting on the pavement’
item.description: Asma Shaikh, a 17-year-old homeless girl, has big dreams. But the pandemic has brought new challenges.

item.title: Ever Given: Time-lapse video captures Felixstowe arrival
item.description: "We could still see Egyptian sand on its bow," said film-maker Brian Abrams as the ship docked.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals – and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Andre de Grasse claims 200m gold
item.description: Canada's Andre de Grasse finishes fast to overhaul world champion Noah Lyles and win the Olympic 200m title.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sydney McLaughlin smashes record, Kokona Hiraki, 12, wins silver
item.description: Hurdler Sydney McLaughlin smashes her own world record to win 400m hurdles gold on the day 12-year-old Kokona Hiraki becomes the youngest Olympic medallist for 85 years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Golf caddie suffers heatstroke in searing heat
item.description: Players struggle with the heat at the women's Olympic golf, while Canada and Sweden ask for the women's football final to be moved.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Taiwan stars trolled by Chinese nationalists
item.description: Chinese nationalists interpreted support for Taiwan's athletes as support for the island's independence.

item.title: Simone Biles: Tokyo 2020 medallist on 'unique Olympic experience'
item.description: American Simone Biles says she will "forever cherish" her "unique Olympic experience" after taking her overall Games medal haul to seven in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.
